body_html:
it real confuse me a lot. but i found this
ec3f4d6
it shows that the ref has changed from 06733 to 0437.
but in my opinion, read the previous one(06733) helps more than 0437.
it tells why u should add the windows, and it address on a unit of a seq, and 0437 more like on a seq2seq.
of course, the realization of the attentincellwrapper is a little different from the 06733 mentioned.
@alquraishi gives a excellent math,but some place i am not very clear:
is

should be

and in the code, it only has "state", so the "state" means "h_t and c_t"?

body:
it real confuse me a lot. but i found this 
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/ec3f4d62979ef1e70e8e12e2568b13dad45fd39e
it shows that the ref has changed from 06733 to 0437.
but in my opinion, read the previous one(06733) helps more than 0437.
it tells why u should add the windows, and it address on a unit of a seq, and 0437 more like on a seq2seq.
of course, the realization of the attentincellwrapper is a little different from the 06733 mentioned.
@alquraishi  gives a excellent math,but some place i am not very clear:
is 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2640812/34261076-fcb18b12-e6a2-11e7-80ee-246c0fa01561.png)
should be
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2640812/34261114-1b4f577a-e6a3-11e7-980e-af578267347a.png)
and in the code, it only has "state", so the "state" means "h_t and c_t"?
